intro: Schoenocrambe decumbens, commonly known as the prostrate cress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its small white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in racemes. The plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
